meanings.definition: To bring back to one's own country.
meanings.sent1: She decided to patriate her family from abroad and return home.
meanings.sent2: The soldier was excited to patriate after serving overseas for many years.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to patriate itself back to its favorite spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: The old photographs patriated memories of childhood summers by the lake.
meanings.sent5: The warm smell of fresh bread patriated feelings of comfort and home.

meanings.definition: To transfer (a legislative power) from a colonial authority to a national government.
meanings.sent1: The country decided to patriate the decision-making power to its own leaders.
meanings.sent2: The process to patriate the legal authority was complex but necessary.
meanings.sent3: The document magically patriated the control from the distant rulers to the local officials.
meanings.sent4: The ceremony symbolically patriated the sovereignty to the people of the nation.
meanings.sent5: The transfer of power patriated a new era of independence and self-governance.
